name: Instant Pot® Beef Panang Curry
author: thedailygourmet
summary: This curry takes advantage of pre-made curry paste and it cooks in the Instant Pot®. If you don't have coconut sugar, use brown sugar or palm sugar. Serve over jasmine rice.
ingredients: 1 pound beef top sirloin, thinly sliced
¾ cup coconut milk, or as needed
⅓ cup finely chopped Thai basil
directions: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function
Add oil and curry paste to the hot pot; cook and stir for 1 minute
Add sirloin strips and saute for 2 to 3 minutes
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, for 10 minutes
Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes
Mix in onion, bell peppers, peanut butter, coconut sugar, and fish sauce
Simmer until flavors are well combined, about 5 minutes
Taste and add more coconut milk if curry is too spicy
Sprinkle with Thai basil before serving
